Description: A highly contagious viral disease affecting cloven-hoofed animals
Symptoms: Fever, blisters in mouth, drooling, lameness, loss of appetite
Solution: Isolate affected animals, disinfect equipment, vaccinate healthy animals

Description: A viral disease causing nodules on skin of cattle
Symptoms: Fever, nodules on skin, swelling, reduced milk production
Solution: Treat wounds, provide supportive care, vaccinate healthy animals

Description: Inflammation of the mammary gland usually caused by bacterial infection
Symptoms: Swollen udder, pain, reduced milk yield, redness
Solution: Administer antibiotics, maintain udder hygiene, provide supportive care

Description: A bacterial infection affecting reproductive organs
Symptoms: Fever, abortion, infertility, reduced milk production
Solution: Vaccinate, test and cull infected animals, maintain farm hygiene

Description: A serious bacterial infection that can be fatal
Symptoms: Sudden death, bleeding from orifices, fever, weakness
Solution: Vaccinate livestock, proper disposal of carcasses, disinfect contaminated areas

Description: A bacterial infection common in young cattle
Solution: Vaccinate cattle, provide clean pastures, supportive care for affected animals

Description: A chronic bacterial disease affecting intestines
Symptoms: Chronic diarrhea, weight loss, reduced milk yield, weakness
Solution: No cure, manage with good hygiene, separate infected animals

Description: A bacterial infection that affects lungs
Symptoms: Coughing, weight loss, reduced appetite, lethargy
Solution: Test and cull infected animals, maintain hygiene, vaccinate if available

Description: A viral infection affecting nervous system
Symptoms: Behavioral changes, excessive salivation, paralysis, aggression
Solution: Vaccinate animals, avoid contact with suspected infected animals, control stray animals
